system.description: A mechanical replacement for a lost arm. Common models restore normal function, while higher-quality versions can enhance Strength. Best-craftsmanship bionic arms grant +10 to Strength tests made with that arm.

A mechanical replacement for a lost leg. Common models restore normal movement, while higher-quality versions can improve Agility-based movement. Best-craftsmanship bionic legs grant +10 to Agility tests involving movement.

A mechanical replacement for a lost eye. Restores normal vision. Good-craftsmanship versions include magnifying lenses, IR vision, or low-light filters. Best-craftsmanship grants Dark-sight and +10 to Perception tests involving sight.
A mechanical heart implant that replaces or augments the natural organ. Provides increased stamina and resistance to Blood Loss and Stunning. Grants +1 AP to Body location from internal plating.
Cogitator implants within the brain that boost mental functions. Good-craftsmanship models grant +10 to Logic and Lore tests. Best models grant Unnatural Intelligence (1).
Subdermal armour plating implanted beneath the skin of the skull. Provides +2 AP to the Head location. Common among combat servitors and battle-hardened veterans.

A powerful electromagnet implanted in the palm or forearm. Can be used to manipulate metallic objects at short range, summon weapons to hand, or disarm opponents. Usable a number of times per day equal to WP bonus.
A surgically implanted data port, usually in the base of the skull or along the spine, allowing direct connection to cogitator systems. Grants +10 to Tech-Use tests when connected to a cogitator.
An implanted navigation and location device. The character always knows their exact position relative to known landmarks. Grants +20 to Navigate (Surface) tests.
Implanted magnetic levitation coils allow the user to hover up to 20-30cm above metallic surfaces and move silently. Grants the Hoverer (6) trait while over ferrous terrain.
A cerebral implant that records sensory data, allowing perfect recall of past events. The user can review recorded memories at will. Grants Eidetic Memory and +10 to all Lore tests.

A neural link allowing direct mental control of machinery and devices. Grants +10 to Tech-Use, Operate, and Logic tests when interfaced with a compatible system. Essential for Titan crews and Knight pilots.
A specialised Mind Impulse Unit that allows mental control of a linked weapon. The weapon can be fired as a Free Action once per round and gains +10 to BS tests.
Internal lung and airway filters that protect against airborne toxins, gases, and contaminants. Grants +20 to Toughness tests to resist inhaled poisons and toxic atmospheres.
Implanted mesh or ceramite plates beneath the skin, providing protection without visible modification. Provides +2 AP to Arms, Body, and Legs.
Artificial muscle fibres woven into or replacing natural musculature, providing enhanced physical power. Grants +10 to Strength tests and Unnatural Strength (1).
A replacement or modification to the vocal cords. Can be used to replicate any voice the user has heard (Deceive test to mimic), broadcast at extreme volume, or emit frequencies outside normal range.
A cybernetic eye replacement fitted with a concealed las-weapon. Fires as a hot-shot laspistol (1d10+4 E, Pen 7) with Accurate quality. Uses BS to fire. Short range 20m.
An implanted cogitator that greatly enhances calculation and probability assessment. Grants +10 to Logistics, Commerce, and Gambling tests. Once per session, reroll a failed Logic test.

Implanted energy cells and discharge nodes, usually in the hands. Can absorb and emit electrical energy. Can recharge devices or emit an electrical attack (1d10+WP bonus E, Pen 0, Shocking). Requires Toughness test or suffer 1 Fatigue per use.
